  <script type="text/javascript">
  // <![CDATA[

  function popupCode( url ) {
    window.open(url, "Code", "resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,toolbar=no,status=no,height=150,width=400")
  }

  function toggleCode( id ) {
    if ( document.getElementById )
      elem = document.getElementById( id );
    else if ( document.all )
      elem = eval( "document.all." + id );
    else
      return false;

    elemStyle = elem.style;

    if ( elemStyle.display != "block" ) {
      elemStyle.display = "block"
    } else {
      elemStyle.display = "none"
    }

    return true;
  }

  // Make codeblocks hidden by default
  document.writeln( "<style type=\"text/css\">div.method-source-code { display: none }</style>" )

  // ]]>
  </script>

    <div id="description">
      <p>

The base module that gets included in ActiveRecord::Base. See the documentation for Paperclip::ClassMethods for more useful information. 

    </div>

      <h3 class="section-bar">Public Class methods</h3>

      <div id="method-M000029" class="method-detail">
        <a name="M000029"></a>

        <div class="method-heading">

            onclick="popupCode('Paperclip.src/M000029.html');return false;">
          <span class="method-name">interpolates</span><span class="method-args">(key, &amp;block)</span>
          </a>
        </div>

        <div class="method-description">
        </div>
      </div>

      <div id="method-M000031" class="method-detail">
        <a name="M000031"></a>

        <div class="method-heading">
          <a href="Paperclip.src/M000031.html" target="Code" class="method-signature"
            onclick="popupCode('Paperclip.src/M000031.html');return false;">
          <span class="method-name">log</span><span class="method-args">(message)</span>
          </a>
        </div>

        <div class="method-description">
          <p>

Log a paperclip-specific line. Uses ActiveRecord::Base.logger by default. Set Paperclip.options[:log] to false to turn off. 

        </div>
      </div>

      <div id="method-M000028" class="method-detail">
        <a name="M000028"></a>

        <div class="method-heading">
          <a href="Paperclip.src/M000028.html" target="Code" class="method-signature"
            onclick="popupCode('Paperclip.src/M000028.html');return false;">
          <span class="method-name">options</span><span class="method-args">()</span>
          </a>
        </div>

        <div class="method-description">
          <p>

Provides configurability to Paperclip. There are a number of options available, such as:

  • whiny: Will raise an error if Paperclip cannot process thumbnails of an uploaded image. Defaults to true.

  • log: Logs progress to the Rails log. Uses ActiveRecord&8216;s logger, so honors log levels, etc. Defaults to true.

  • command_path: Defines the path at which to find the command line programs if they are not visible to Rails the system&8216;s search path. Defaults to nil, which uses the first executable found in the user&8216;s search path.

  • image_magick_path: Deprecated alias of command_path. 

        </div>
      </div>

      <div id="method-M000030" class="method-detail">
        <a name="M000030"></a>

        <div class="method-heading">
          <a href="Paperclip.src/M000030.html" target="Code" class="method-signature"
            onclick="popupCode('Paperclip.src/M000030.html');return false;">
          <span class="method-name">run</span><span class="method-args">(cmd, params = &quot;&quot;, expected_outcodes = 0)</span>
          </a>
        </div>

        <div class="method-description">
          <p>

The run method takes a command to execute and a string of parameters that get passed to it. The command is prefixed with the :command_path option from Paperclip.options. If you have many commands to run and they are in different paths, the suggested course of action is to symlink them so they are all in the same directory.

If the command returns with a result code that is not one of the expected_outcodes, a PaperclipCommandLineError will be raised. Generally a code of 0 is expected, but a list of codes may be passed if necessary.

This method can log the command being run when Paperclip.options[:log_command] is set to true (defaults to false). This will only log if logging in general is set to true as well. 

        </div>
      </div>

    </div>

  </div>
